messages.sender: cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify
messages.message:
i’m having an issue with typings in a view handler im writing. i’m seeing the errors in travis, but wanted to figure out how to run the same check locally. can anyone point me in the right place? this is the check that’s failing:
```python3 /instabase_dir/webserver/apps-server/../../shared-utils/py-utils/typing-utils/src/py/scripts/run_mypy.py \```

messages.sender: cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify
messages.message: to clarify - i know my typings are wrong but now am tired of pushing up and waiting for travis to tell me too :stuck_out_tongue:
haha just cd into webserver/app-server and run `make clean build mypy`

messages.sender: cross talk - a podcast about crosswords - listen on apple podcasts or spotify

messages.message: that works in any python service or lib. you also dont have to run clean everytime
here’s a doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1abIC5dqt_YET4szxEh6pjd83DA2LIRNEypZGDleWtQ0/edit#) on more testing short-cuts you can run locally to avoid waiting on travis
